Data Pertumbuhan Ekonomi RI Diragukan, Kepala BPS Buka Suara
05 Nov 2019, 11:27 by Danang Sugianto


Foto: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) telah mengumumkan pertumbuhan ekonomi pada triwulan III-2019. Tercatat ekonomi RI tumbuh 5,02% (y-on-y).Data itu diragukan oleh beberapa ekonom asing. Salah satunya lembaga ekonomi yang bernama Capital Economics.Mereka curiga pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia yang dalam beberapa waktu terakhir bertahan di kisaran 5% tidak sesuai kenyataan. Menurut catatan Capital Economics pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia jauh lebih rendah dari laporan BPS."Pertumbuhan PDB di Indonesia telah lama stabil di sekitar 5% selama lima tahun terakhir. Peneliti aktivitas ekonomi Indonesia kami menunjukkan bahwa ekonomi tumbuh pada realisasi yang jauh lebih lemah," tulis Capital Economics dalam laporannya yang dilansir Selasa (5/11/2019).Mendengar hal itu, Kepala BPS Suhariyanto pun angkat bicara. Dia menjelaskan bahwa dalam menghitung Produk Domestik Bruto (PDB) BPS juga diawasi oleh banyak pihak, termasuk lembaga pemberi utang internasional IMF."Ketika kita menghitung PDB, semuanya harus mengacu pada manual dari PDB. Harus diikuti semuanya. Kedua, BPS ini dimonitor oleh forum masyarakat statistik. Yang kedua temab-teman IMF selalu datang ke BPS minimal sekali setahun dengan timnya check," terangnya."Dan selama lima tahun berturut-turut, kita dapat statement bahwa data PDB akurat. Sekarang betul nggak bahwa kita stable? Nggak juga, dari 5,17% ke 5,02% kan turunnya tajam," tambahnya.Jika dilihat dari komponennya memang rata-rata melemah. Konsumsi rumah tangga pada kuartal III-2019 5,01% turun dari kuartal sebelumnya 5,17%.Sementara untuk investasi ada PMTB tercatat tumbuh 4,21% atau turun dari kuartal sebelumnya 5,01%. Sedangkan konsumsi pemerintah tumbuh 0,98% jauh lebih lambat dari pertumbuhan kuartal sebelumnya 8,25%.Ekspor barang dan jasa hanya tumbuh 0,02% naik dari kuartal sebelumnya yang terkoreksi -1,98%. Sementara impor barang dan jasa terkoreksi -8,61% lebih rendah dari kuartal sebelumnya yang terkoreksi 6,78%."Saya tunjukkan clear, bahwa sebetulnya kalau kalian mengumpulkan data sebelumnya, bahwa impor mesin dan perlengkapan itu kan dalem banget. Ekonominya berarti nggak paham dia. Siapa yang ngomong," ujarnya.Pria yang akrab disapa Kecuk itu pun menantang balik Capital Economics untuk menjabarkan prediksinya. "Coba dong ngomong prediksinya berapa. Check prediksinya dia, tapi bandingkan dengan semua prediksi yang di bawah 5% dikit sekali," tutupnya.Simak Video "Sandi: Pemerintah Terjebak Dalam Pertumbuhan Ekonomi 5%"[Gambas:Video 20detik](das/fdl)

Indonesian Economic Growth Data Doubtful, BPS Chief Opens Voice
05 Nov 2019, 11:27 by Danang Sugianto


Photo: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) has announced economic growth in quarter III-2019. Indonesia's economic growth recorded 5.02% (y-on-y). The data was doubted by some foreign economists. One of them is an economic institution called Capital Economics. They are suspicious of Indonesia's economic growth which in the last few years has remained in the range of 5% does not match reality. According to the Capital Economics record, Indonesia's economic growth is much lower than the BPS report. "GDP growth in Indonesia has long been stable at around 5% over the past five years. Our Indonesian economic activity researchers show that the economy is growing at a much weaker realization," Capital wrote Economics in its report that was launched on Tuesday (11/05/2019). Hearing that, BPS Head Suhariyanto also spoke up. He explained that in calculating the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) BPS is also monitored by many parties, including the international lending institutions IMF. "When we calculate GDP, everything must refer to the manual of GDP. All must be followed. Second, this BPS is monitored by the forum "statistics society. The second IMF friends always come to BPS at least once a year with his team check," he explained. "And for five years in a row, we can statement that the GDP data is accurate. Now is it true that we are stable? from 5.17% to 5.02% right, it dropped sharply, "he added. If seen from the components, the average is weakening. Household consumption in quarter III-2019 5.01% decreased from 5.17% in the previous quarter. Meanwhile for investment there was PMTB recorded a growth of 4.21% or down from the previous quarter of 5.01%. While government consumption grew by 0.98%, much slower than the previous quarter's growth of 8.25%. Exports of goods and services grew only 0.02%, up from the previous quarter, which corrected -1.98%. While the import of goods and services was corrected -8.61% lower than the previous quarter which was corrected by 6.78%. "I showed clearly, that if you actually collected data beforehand, that the import of machinery and equipment was really inside. The economy means you don't understand he is. Who's talking, "he said. The man who is familiarly called Kecuk also challenged Capital Economics to explain his predictions. "Try to say how many predictions. Check his predictions, but compare with all predictions under 5% a little," he concluded.
